page.title: 18ATTITUDES OF TIDWORTH
page.content: There are two distinct sections of Tidworth as far as the population is concerned; civilian and military. On the whole there is little mixing done on a social scale between the two. Some civilians are upset by some of the military personnel who abandon their pets when regiments move. The quarters area at Zouch and Matthew Estates have a litter problem and the River Bourne gets polluted by dumped rubbish. Recently there has been much talk about moving the county border so Tidworth is wholly in either Wiltshire or Hampshire. The old school was demolished earlier this year and the closure of the Station Road Post Office caused much concern. The site of an oil pipeline now runs along the eastern edge of the village and many people were saddened by the cutting down of trees in the woodland.
